intro: [WRONG START] Embilia paniculata, commonly known as the Indian gooseberry or amla, is a small evergreen shrub native to Southeast Asia. It is characterized by its simple, opposite leaves and small, yellowish-green flowers that are clustered in panicles. The plant produces small, round fruits that turn from green to yellow or orange as they mature. The fruits are rich in vitamin C and are widely used in traditional medicine and culinary applications. Its botanical features make it an important species in both ecological and economic contexts.
